DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Submission Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to questions which are necessary to allow clinical trial participation that are related to the submission of patient's biospecimens as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Submission Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ReferenceDocuments.name: If a tumour block cannot be s
ReferenceDocuments.description: If a tumour block cannot be sent, will two 2 mm cores of tumour from the block and 20 x 5 micron thick unstained slides be submitted to CCTG Central Tumour Bank instead?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will patient be enrolling on a treatment protocol that requires specimen submission to the Molecular Characterization Initiative?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will patient be screened for or enrolling on a treatment protocol that utilizes specimen submission to the Molecular Characterization Initiative?
